bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, April 30, 1928

div1.p: Russell expresses delight that Carter is back at work on the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever and sends her reprints of recent work on yellow fever in West Africa that confirms Henry Rose Carter's theory that yellow fever originally came out of Africa.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, April 30, 1928
div1.opener:
Misel
Russell
re
Reports (weekly
Copy of letter from Dr. Russell.
April 30, 1928.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I thank you for your letter of the 28th. of April, and am rejoiced
that you are again at work. I am sending you under separate cover two re-
prints representing the latest work in yellow fever in West Africa. As you
will see, they are of fundamental importance, and after reading them you will
realize why it is that it is so important to have your Father's work made
public soon. He was the first one, or at least the most prominent one, to
state that the disease came out of Africa. All that we are learning from our
studies in Africa tend to confirm this opinion of your Father's.

Do not bother to write long letters, but if you will drop me a note
of the very briefest nature once a week letting know hour you are gettingalong
I shall appreciate it it greatly.
